splice2neo 0.5.6
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Formats pangolin output and filter for predicted effects

Source: R/format_pangolin.R
format_pangolin.Rd

Reformat the data for each annotated effect per row. As pangolin does not provide information on donor or acceptor, use both for gain and loss annotations. Effects with score = 0 are filtered out.

format_pangolin(variants)

Arguments

variants

tibble with parsed pangolin mutations from parse_pangolin

Value

A tibble with splicing effects per row

See also

parse_spliceai, annotate_mut_effect, format_spliceai

Examples

pangolin_file <- system.file("extdata", "spliceai_output.pangolin.vcf", package = "splice2neo")
df <- parse_pangolin(pangolin_file)
format_pangolin(df)
#> # A tibble: 18 × 6
#>    mut_id                 effect score chr   pos_rel       pos
